Posts.Content: lol I am daft - reading too much into things as usual!
Posts.Title: Her2ve+

Posts.Content: Hi noticed her2ve+ on notes.   Obviously I know I'm her2 positive.    What does the ve stand for
Posts.Title: Her2ve+

Posts.Content: Hi all, finished breast cancer treatment end of August this year.   Had mastectomy in May, still on Herceptin.   Feeling very lost and let down.  Since surgery in May did not get follow up appt and not one person has looked at wound.  Is this normal, never had any type of surgery before so have no idea what to expect.   When I phoned the bcn she said nothing came back in pathology so why do you need to see surgeon.  I live in Northern Ireland and thinks seem a bit different here.   Bcn are terrible, no contact or support at all.  I asked for appt to see oncologist to answer some queries I had and he was too busy!!   What happens now re check ups etc, what should I expect.  When is your next Mammo, when they say a year is that after diagnosis, surgery or what.  I have not been physically examined for about eight months.   Feel very ignored and lost.
Posts.Title: Feeling list

Posts.Content: Had sixth chemo yesterday, two to go.   Have reduced dose to 75 per cent, side effects were really kicking in, have been hospitalised twice.  I know I always post about my fears but can not find any other ladies out there that seem to have a worse diagnosis than me.  I just turned 45, diagnosed with phelomorphic lobular with large node involvement, extending to my collarbone.   Plan is eight chemo,  surgery then radio.   Tumour is hugh 10cm x 5cm x 5cm.  Dr said yesterday he has never made me any promises .  Just feel going by stats there is no way I will survive this.  Has anyone else had similar diagnosis and could give me some hope x
Posts.Title: Very scared

Posts.Content: Thanks needed those virtual hugs.  Trying to stay positive tumour has shrunk and nodes completely disappeared.  Really want to beat this - have five lovely grandkids and like us all have too much to live for!
Posts.Title: Very scared

Posts.Content: Just standard fec-t, having eight instead of the usual six.   Have just had seventh on Tuesday, one to go.   No they just brushed over it.   Mine is very unusual, her2 positive er/pr neg, which apparently is not good.   Having really down day today, feel there is no hope
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: Hi, my lobular is also phelomorphic.  Are you Her2 positive as most her2 lobular are phelomorphic.  I totally panicked and over goggled when I found out this but did myself no favours.  I know think it is what it is and I'll deal with it.  The one thing about this sneaky bc none of us knows what the future holds, just got to keep the chin up
Posts.Title: my invasive lobular carinoma tested positive for being pleomorphic...

Posts.Content: Have saw oncologist today, had four fec.   Due to have Docetaxol today but he said my last heart scan showed heart function down so he can't give me herception.  Has ordered another heart scan and then referred me to the cardiology team. Anyone else have any similar promblems.  Really gutted, need that Herceptin - am her2 positive
Posts.Title: Heart function and herception

Posts.Content: Thanks again guys for your informative posts  - I have enjoyed reading your posts you are a bundle of great advice x
Posts.Title: Heart function and herception
